message: I'm excited to offer you this great product, and I think it's a fair price considering its value to you. I'm willing to sell it to you for $12000.
I appreciate your enthusiasm for the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $9000. I'm willing to make a serious offer, but I need to stay within my budget.
I understand you have a budget constraint, but I believe the product's value to you is higher than $9000. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit. I'm counteroffering at $11000.
I'm not getting any closer to my budget with $11000. I'm willing to go up to $10000, but that's as high as I can go. I'm hoping we can meet in the middle.

I understand you're trying to stay within your budget, but I'm not willing to go as low as $10000. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to the value you place on the product. I'm counteroffering at $12500.
I'm not willing to go up to $12500. I'm still at $10000, and I'm willing to negotiate further. I'm hoping we can find a mutually beneficial price.

I'm starting to think we're not going to meet in the middle, Bob. I'm willing to make one more serious offer, but I need to get closer to the value you place on the product. I'm counteroffering at $13500.
I'm not willing to go up to $13500. I'm still at $10000, and I'm starting to think that's the best we can do. I'm willing to walk away if we can't meet in the middle.
